intro: Dombeya lucida subsp. hafomeana, commonly known as the Hafomean dombeya, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming in spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after species for botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
